name: River Manor Boutique Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: River manor is a bit of a haven a short walk from Stellenbosch town centre. Staff are endlessly helpful and the 2 pools adds a dimension of comfort and relaxation more. The two old houses and their gardens have been combined in to one lush hotel that helps you make the most of Stellenbosch and the wine lands around it.
reviews.title: Quiet charming and welcoming Stellenbosch suburb hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we arrived early the staff made every effort to get us into our room, which they did most efficiently. We had chosen Stennelbosch to tour the Windelands and part of the Garden Route and also because it is a Town and Gown centre. The outstanding friendlieness of Ferencia and all the staff made our stay so comfortable. On top of this the Manager, Justin, gave great advice as well directions in order that we saw and visited the places we were interested in. We would absolutely recommend both the town, which is very safe, the area and, most of all,the Hotel and the staff.
reviews.title: Superb warm and friendly boutique hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff extemely friendly,courteous, attentive and accommodating. The hotel is two adjacent old houses which exude colonial charm. Our room was very comfortable with all the usual amenities. A delightful breakfast was served in the garden or indoors as desired and Justin, the General Manager, was on hand each morning to assist with plans for the day. The hotel has two small pools and ample sunbeds. There was no bar/restaurant but the staff were always on hand to provide drinks when required and there was a limited light meal selection. The hotel booked our wine tour which was excellent (ask for Eileen to be your guide!) and we ended up doing a full day tour instead of the half day we had booked. Thank you Justin for arranging the forwarding on of the sunglasses!
reviews.title: Colonial style small hotel conveniently situated within a short walk of restaurants/bars.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: River Manor is in a great location for exploring Stellenbosch on foot, but stil in a quiet and peaceful spot.
reviews.title: Small, Friendly & Central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only had a night here, but the staff were all friendly and polite and very attentive. Whilst relaxing by the small pool they checked regularly if we needed drinks or anything else. We did not use the spa, but it seemed as though a number of the other guests were using it and happy with the treatments provided.
reviews.title: Would certainly return again

reviews.text: I had a Monday business meeting in the Stellenbosch area and was flying in on the Sunday, so needed somewhere to stay for one night. It turned out to be a good choice as the staff were friendly and the room was well appointed. I would happily stay there for a romantic few days as it had a really nice atmosphere and the staff were very friendly. Breakfast was excellent with a good variety on offer. The had free WiFi. The only thing a bit wierd was the lack of any obvious heating in the room. I managed without any heating, but if my wife was with me, she would have complained.
reviews.title: Great Service, Nice historic building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from 3 weeks in South Africa and our stay at River Manor was excellent. Its location is great as its in easy walking distance of the main restaurants etc and Justin and the team made our stay very pleasent indeed
reviews.title: Great central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent four nights in April at River Manor - our second visit, having first visited several years ago. The hotel is bigger now, with better facilities including a little spa, but we were delighted to find that the warm welcome and attention to detail were as excellent as ever. Johan and Leigh are charming hosts, and much in evidence. Our room was spacious, nicely appointed and wonderfully comfortable - though our favourite spot was the lovely verandah where we would read and rest after a hard day's winetasting. First-class massage, too.
reviews.title: delightful hotel with charming service and central but tranquil location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we adored our time here and it was one of our favourite hotels (out of 8 visited), our room being a particular highlight. We had an excellent meal in Stellenbosch and thoroughly enjoyed our day of wine tasting, all of which was organised very efficiently.
reviews.title: Excellent, Friendly and stunning accommodation
Bliss
reviews.text: Such a relaxed and beautiful old house to stay in, lovely restaurants nearby, staff very helpful, can walk into Stellenbosch for shops/restaurants. A very peaceful and lovely place to stay. Definately recommend doing the wine tour the hotel will book for you.
River Manor is a good place to go to if you like old mansions that feel like History.
reviews.title: Good location to have a walk in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very welcoming and when we were hungry at night but too tired to go out, they made us a great simple dinner that was much appreciated.
reviews.title: Great ending to our holiday in South-Africa

reviews.text: Our bedroom was large as well as the nice Victorian bathroom.
reviews.title: Superb Start to our South African Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The mansion makes you feel like home as you can enjoy reading on the couch next the chimney.
reviews.title: Cute manor with friendly staff

reviews.text: The breaksfast was not the best we had but was still alright with great choice.
reviews.title: Just not sure all a bit false
Lovely Manor
reviews.text: Three couples stayed at the River Manor recently and truly enjoyed it. We only spent one night but enjoyed a peacful evening, after touring the wine country, drinking wine in the porch area. The rooms were very nice and the staff was very friendly.

We had a wonderful stay at River Manor. The accomodation is spacious and extremely comfortable. The staff are very helpful. They were great with my 7 year old daughter and made her feel like a special guest there. The breakfast was delicious! I thoroughly recommend you stay at River Manor and Spa.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow, what a gem this was. True South African hospitality, fabulous accommodation and perfect location.
reviews.title: Great Winelands Getaway

reviews.text: Although we only stayed one night this hotel really did give us the relaxing and rejuvenating break we needed. The SPA is amazing! The rooms are spacious and have everything you could need. Rooms are located in a lovely setting around the pool area which I can only imagine to be great in Summer! The staff are super friendly and accommodating and Managers are truly hands on and full of insider tips and advise on where to get the best of everything, from views to service, meals and wine!
reviews.title: Nice hotel in nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is now definitely on my top 10 places in Cape Town list!!
reviews.title: Nothing special

description: River Manor is nestled in the heart of Stellenboch and the Western Cape Winelands. Set across from the Eerste River, in a peaceful avenue of Oak trees, just a short stroll from the village centre, with its museums, street cafés, and galleries, allowing guests to delight in a truly unique Stellenbosch experience.Elegantly furnished in a Contemporary Colonial Style, with personal service and attention to detail - the, wrap-around verandas, two swimming pools, a Studio Spa and secluded gardens, exude an atmosphere of luxury and privacy allowing for relaxation and comfort. A light and seasonal menu is offered at “Taste” enjoyed in the shade of the garden or in the Conservatory, complimented by a charming “Garden Bar”.Stylish rooms combine the conveniences of home with superior comforts, fruit details, bathrobes, Port and Sherry trays and evening turndowns, an experience of a bygone era. Not forgetting necessary modern conveniences of minibars, in room safes, tea and coffee trays, Wifi, overhead ceiling fans and air-conditioning.After leisurely poolside breakfasts, guests may enjoy guided Wine Tours departing daily from River Manor, or take a self drive through the majestic countryside to nearby golf courses, Franschhoek, Cape Town or Hermanus - to return to the sunny terrace to view a beautiful African sunset.
